tables.table_schema: A legal team can use a SQL database to maintain a log of court appearances and case updates for child custody proceedings.

CREATE TABLE court_appearances (
  appearance_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  case_id UUID,
  date DATE,
  time TIME,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  judge VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE case_updates (
  update_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  case_id UUID,
  update_date DATE,
  update_time TIME,
  update_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE CourtAppearances (
    appearance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    hearing_date DATE,
    case_id INT,
    attorney_id INT,
    outcome VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE CaseUpdates (
    update_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    case_id INT,
    update_date DATE,
    update_description TEXT,
    updated_by VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE ChildCustodyCases (
    case_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    case_number VARCHAR(50),
    client_id INT,
    opposing_party_id INT,
    court_location VARCHAR(255),
    case_status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE court_appearances (
    appearance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    case_id INT,
    appearance_date DATE,
    lawyer_id INT,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    outcome VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE case_updates (
    update_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    case_id INT,
    update_date DATE,
    updater_id INT,
    update_details TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE cases (
    case_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    child_name VARCHAR(50),
    parent1 VARCHAR(50),
    parent2 VARCHAR(50),
    court_location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE court_appearances (
    appearance_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    case_id UUID NOT NULL,
    appearance_date DATE NOT NULL,
    judge_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    attorney_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE case_updates (
    update_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    case_id UUID NOT NULL,
    update_date DATE NOT NULL,
    update_description TEXT NOT NULL,
    updated_by VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE child_custody_cases (
    case_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    child_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    parent1_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    parent2_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    current_status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL
);
